data.title: Good Value for Sushi
data.text: This place has good economical sushi (nigiri and rolls) and other menu items.  Evidently it is very popular looking at the people in and out at 2 pm.  I only had rolls, but saw nigiri served others.  Our rolls were pretty good, but the rice was a little cold.  Be selective -- a lot of the rolls are Americanized.  However, for the price, it is a good stop for lunch or carryout.  (not a place for a fancy sit down dinner).

data.title: Diamond in disguise
data.text: A tiny Sushi shop in a strip mall setting that is probably the best value around. Always fresh and excellent regardless of what you order. Great pricing and the nicest people they have been at this location for 20 years and haven't changed the setup. Its is a bit tight because their space is so narrow and there are only 3 or for tables available so it's mostly a takeout operation. With that said, IT IS WELL WORTH IT.

data.title: Best sushi ever!
data.text: This is the best sushi I have ever tried. The service is very fast too. Oh, and did I also mention that they are pretty cheap?

data.title: Great no-frills and authentic sushi
data.text:
Sushi-One is a tiny hole-in-the-wall place, the kind where you can get great, authentic food for cheap. The sushi is fresh and made right in front of you. They're traditional rolls, nothing fancy. Pretty much everything on the menu is under $10.

The place is very small and has only 3 2-person tables inside, and a couple more tables outside. It's more of a take-out place. Lines can reach the door during lunch rush hour. I usually call ahead and pick my order up within 10 minutes.

data.title: My favourite sushi place out of Japan
data.text: A small but clean shop with a fantatic sushi. I cannot remember how many times I ate their food, always fantastic. The interesting part is that you can see your sushi been prepared in front of you and waiters and chefs are very kind! Must visit, and if your first impression looking at the place is not good, give it a chance anyway! It's worthy. I lived closed to their shop and never went in till a chinese colleague brought me to the best sushi place in south Florida and guess what? That was the place! Much better that other sushi restaurants in the surroundings ...

data.title: Stay FAR from the daily special!
data.text:
The sushi is decent & priced right, so the place is popular. I can recommend the sushi, but whoever inspires the daily special is a detriment to this place.
Picture this... a fried breaded chicken cutlet (cold) with a side of bbq sauce, potato salad, white rice, shredded cabbage no dressing...creative Japanese food? NOT! So awful, I wouldn't feed it to a hog!
Be warned: Don't call for pick up unless it's sushi you've already tried.

data.title: Fast, cheap and decent
data.text: This is a VERY narrow and small take out place, although they do have a couple of small tables.  It is a volume business, and they churn out A LOT of sushi.  That bodes well for the fish being fresh, and I have found that to be consistently true.  But it is not the highest quality of sushi - not even close.  It's pretty good, and very convenient, and that's why I and many others keep going back.  But if you want quality sushi, go somewhere else.

data.title: Good sushi and great prices
data.text: Looked up restaurants near Fort Lauderdale with one $ sign on Google and this one came up and saw some great reviews, so I headed for it. The variety was good, but the prices was something that I was surprised about! It was so cheap! Don't get me wrong, the quality was there too.

data.title: Very tasty
data.text: Had the new times and it was perfectly delicious, also had the small salad. The ginger dressing was on point but I could have used more. Def a good spot to order out or eat in.

data.title: Cheap sushi made fresh
data.text: It's heavy on some fillings like "Krab" but for a quick sushi fix at a good price, I love this place. The soups are good!!

data.title: Secret to a perfect party
data.text: No fuss and great quality food are great ingredients for a perfect party...Sushi One makes this possible.  Have a menu handy and a phone, so within an hour you can host an Asian theme party everyone will enjoy for a very reasonable price.  The restaurant has limited seating and no bar, so it is easier to order TAKE-OUT and enjoy at home.  Wonderful, hard working and quality minded staff.  definitely a win:win...love it!

data.title: Fast and tastie
data.text: 10 min by car from hotel. Excellent spicy tuna roll perfect portion size for me. Made quickly, right price and tasty. Busy place now will wait even it takes longer

data.title: Sushi One is NUMBA ONE!!!!
data.text:
Although very small inside, 3 tables in and 3 outside.....their sushi is the freshest and most reasonable in Fort Lauderdale.  We go at least twice a week for lunch.  It is located in a little mall if you need to go to the drug store.
Mama-san runs the order-out and cash register, and papa-san makes shushi with a crew of three.  They have been written up several times, and is is a great place to eat lunch, or get some takeout for dinner.

data.title: A well-kept secret
data.text: I hesitate to even write this, because lines might get longer...but this is a great takeout sushi spot. Not the most creative menu, not fancy, but good fish, priced well. We get a big takeout platter for two of us...it gives us two meals each. Counter staff is friendly. Almost no seating.

data.title: Great value and service
data.text: On  our last night on vacation in Florida, the kids wanted sushi, and this was the place we found with the best selection on simpler rolls.  They have the fancier stuff, too, but our kids just like plain cucumber or avocado, and the other places didn't seem to have that.  It was perfect.  They were friendly and helpful as we reviewed the menu.  They prepared the food very quickly, and it was good, and very inexpensive.  It's not a pretty place, but we wanted fast and good, especially with 3 hungry, grumpy and tired kids.  Only a few tables inside and a few outside.  Most of their business is takeout.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Best kept secret in Ft Lauderdale!
data.text: In a small strip center on Broward Blvd/Federal Hwy there lies a small sushi restaurant that is mostly take out, but there are some tables both inside & outside.  The sushi is always fresh & delicious.  Best prices & sushi in all Fort Lauderdale!!  The cashiers by now knows exactly how we order our food!  Maybe we are there way too often, but it's sooo good!!

data.title: DA BEST SUSHI
data.text: Sushi One is the best sushi place in Fort Lauderdale.  It's a mama-san and papa-san + kids operation that closes one month of the year so the owners can go back to JAPAN!!  The sushi is so fresh - it melts in your mouth and their lunch special are super delicious.  It's maily a lunch thing and take out of course, but eating outside is also fun.

data.title: Excellent all around
data.text: This place is fantastic. Fast & friendly service. The freshness of the fish is always great. My favorite part is the pricing. They have their smallest party platter: 42 pieces for $24. I would highly recommend this place. My boyfriend and I will be back many times.

data.title: Take out
data.text: La qualité des ingrédients semble très bonne, le personnel est gentil et les prix sont très raisonnables. Sur 4 personnes 3 ont beaucoup aimé et moi moins. Je trouvais les duchés un peu fades sans vraiment pouvoir expliquer pourquoi. Peut-être que le riz manquait d'assaisonnement?  Beaucoup mieux pour un take out que pour manger sur place.

data.title: Ótimo custo benefício
data.text: Mais um daqueles que poucos turistas conhecem, um lugar pequeno, simples, mas com um Sushi muito bom e de ótimo preço. Simples assim!
